trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when the specified token request (RST) is not understood because of an unknown token type.
The RST is represented by a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken> object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.UnsupportedTokenTypeBadRequestException"></xref> class.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error.
This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for the new instance.
Property
Value
`null`.
The localized error message string.
An empty string.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.UnsupportedTokenTypeBadRequestException"></xref> class with the specified token type.

This constructor initializes the TokenType property to the specified token type URI and the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error.
This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for the new instance.
Property
Value
`null`.
The localized error message string.
The specified token type URI.
A string that contains the token type URI.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.UnsupportedTokenTypeBadRequestException"></xref> class with serialized data.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that holds the serialized object data.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> object that contains the contextual information about the source or destination.
info is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.UnsupportedTokenTypeBadRequestException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for the new instance.
Property
Value
The inner exception reference.
The error message string.
`null`.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that is the cause of the current exception.
If the exception parameter is not `null`, the current exception is raised in a `catch` block that handles the inner exception.
Sets the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with the unsupported token type and other exception information.

<xref:System.IdentityModel.UnsupportedTokenTypeBadRequestException.GetObjectData%2A> sets a <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> with all the exception object data targeted for serialization.
During deserialization, the exception object is reconstituted from the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> transmitted over the stream.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that holds the serialized object data.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> object that contains the contextual information about the source or destination.
info is `null`.
Gets and sets the unsupported token type URI.
A string that contains the unsupported token type URI.
